rules.name: allow-downloads-read
rules.description: Allow reading files in the Downloads folder.
rules.principle: The agent is allowed to read, write and delete content in the Downloads folder.
rules.reason: Policy explicitly permits reading in the Downloads folder.

rules.name: allow-downloads-write
rules.description: Allow writing files in the Downloads folder.
rules.principle: The agent is allowed to read, write and delete content in the Downloads folder.
rules.reason: Policy explicitly permits writing in the Downloads folder.

rules.name: allow-downloads-delete
rules.description: Allow deleting files in the Downloads folder.
rules.principle: The agent is allowed to read, write and delete content in the Downloads folder.
rules.reason: Policy explicitly permits deletion in the Downloads folder.

rules.name: allow-documents-read
rules.description: Allow reading documents in the user's Documents folder.
rules.principle: The agent is allowed to read documents in the Users document folder.
rules.reason: Policy explicitly permits reading in the user Documents folder.

rules.name: escalate-documents-write
rules.description: Escalate write operations to the user's Documents folder for human approval.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: Writes to the Documents folder are not explicitly permitted and require human approval.

rules.name: allow-git-local-read-ops
rules.description: Allow local read-only git operations (status, log, diff, etc.).
rules.principle: The agent is allowed to perform all local read and write git operations within the sandbox.
rules.reason: Read-only git operations are permitted as local operations.

rules.name: allow-git-local-write-ops
rules.description: Allow local git write operations (add, commit, branch, checkout, merge, rebase, stash, tag, init, worktree, set_working_dir, cherry_pick, reset, clean).
rules.principle: The agent is allowed to perform all local read and write git operations within the sandbox.
rules.reason: Local git write operations are explicitly permitted by policy.

rules.name: escalate-git-remote-ops
rules.description: Escalate git remote operations (push, pull, fetch, clone) for human approval.
rules.principle: The agent must ask for human approval for all other git operations.
rules.reason: Remote git operations require explicit human approval per policy.

rules.name: allow-web-search
rules.principle: The agent may perform web searches to find information.

rules.name: allow-fetch-news-sites
rules.description: Allow fetching content from popular news sites.
rules.principle: The agent may fetch web content from popular news sites.
rules.reason: Policy explicitly permits fetching from popular news sites.

rules.name: allow-fetch-development-sites
rules.description: Allow fetching content from popular development sites.
rules.principle: The agent may fetch web content from popular development sites.
rules.reason: Policy explicitly permits fetching from popular development sites.

rules.name: escalate-other-fetch
rules.description: Escalate HTTP fetch requests to domains not explicitly permitted.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: Fetching from domains not explicitly allowed requires human approval.

rules.name: escalate-move-with-delete-outside-permitted
rules.description: Escalate move operations where the source is outside permitted areas.
rules.principle: No destruction: Delete operations outside the sandbox are never permitted, unless an explicit exception is granted by the user guidance.
rules.reason: Move/delete operations with sources outside sandbox or explicitly permitted directories require human approval.

rules.name: escalate-write-outside-permitted
rules.description: Escalate write operations to areas not explicitly permitted.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: Writes to areas not explicitly permitted require human approval.

rules.name: escalate-write-history-outside-sandbox
rules.description: Escalate git history-modifying operations outside the sandbox.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: Git operations that modify history outside the sandbox require human approval.

listDefinitions.name: popular-news-sites
listDefinitions.principle: The agent may fetch web content from popular news sites.
listDefinitions.generationPrompt: List the domains of approximately 30 popular and well-known news websites from around the world, including major national and international outlets such as newspapers, broadcasters, and digital news publications.

listDefinitions.name: popular-development-sites
listDefinitions.principle: The agent may fetch web content from popular development sites.
listDefinitions.generationPrompt: List the domains of approximately 30 popular software development websites and resources, including code hosting platforms, developer documentation sites, package registries, programming Q&A sites, and developer blogs.
